intro: Cardia agrestis, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Cardia. It grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and roadsides, often forming dense colonies. Cardia agrestis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils.
